title: How to Get a High Score at Pacman

steps.headline: Try to collect as many Pac-Dots without using the four big ones.
One way to never get caught by one Ghost is to follow them, since they cannot change their direction.
If you have many ghosts on your tail, try to get to a Blink Dot as quickly as you can.
Work at one area at a time, then move to the next one.
For maximum points, collect the fruit when it pops up, and eat the ghosts when they turn blue.
Since the maze never changes, try creating a pattern which you will go through to eat the dots.
steps.description: Just keep on repeating the pattern that works best for you.

steps.headline: Each ghost behaves differently.
steps.description:
Red follows Pac-man, Pink and Blue try to travel to where Pac-man seems to be headed and orange takes a random path throughout the maze. This is crucial to obtaining very high scores if you know how each ghost acts. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/Get-a-High-Score-at-Pacman-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/Get-a-High-Score-at-Pacman-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Every now and then, the ghosts will change direction and head to a certain corner to circle the corner of the maze.
steps.description: Use this time to grab a fruit if there is one in the middle, or eat as many pellets as possible.

steps.headline: If there are ghosts on your tail, go through a section of the maze where there are no pellets because you travel faster when not eating pellets

text:
Try to collect as many Pac-Dots without using the four big ones. One way to never get caught by one Ghost is to follow them, since they cannot change their direction. If you have many ghosts on your tail, try to get to a Blink Dot as quickly as you can. Work at one area at a time, then move to the next one. For maximum points, collect the fruit when it pops up, and eat the ghosts when they turn blue. Since the maze never changes, try creating a pattern which you will go through to eat the dots. Just keep on repeating the pattern that works best for you. Each ghost behaves differently. Red follows Pac-man, Pink and Blue try to travel to where Pac-man seems to be headed and orange takes a random path throughout the maze. This is crucial to obtaining very high scores if you know how each ghost acts. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/Get-a-High-Score-at-Pacman-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/Get-a-High-Score-at-Pacman-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Every now and then, the ghosts will change direction and head to a certain corner to circle the corner of the maze. Use this time to grab a fruit if there is one in the middle, or eat as many pellets as possible. If there are ghosts on your tail, go through a section of the maze where there are no pellets because you travel faster when not eating pellets
